result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob R. Miller

records.addlTxt:
11:30 AM Defendant Jacob R. Miller not in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Jacob R. Miller.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. No appearance by defendant. Atty Thomas-Schmidt states the defendant is in the Chippewa County Jail. State makes argument-requesting an adjournment. No objections.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 21, 2022 at 11:40 am.

10:32 AM Defendant Jacob R. Miller appeared by video, in custody, in the Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Jacob R. Miller.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Waived time limits-Set for preliminary hearing. Bond to continue. Defendant may appear via zoom if in treatment.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
w/ $2,000.00 signature bond.

Absolute sobriety. Must update address with the court.

1:12 PM Defendant Jacob R Miller appeared by video, in custody. Aaron Marcoux appears for the State. Atty Thomas-Schmidt appears for the defendant. Court calls case and appearances. No complaint has been filed at this time. Court Commissioner set back early August. Court reviews PC-finds probable cause. 
Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes bond argument-requesting a high signature or low cash. Court questions the defendant-would be staying at sisters house in Bloomer, WI.
State makes argument-requesting a 2:00 cash bond. Defendant did get accepted into treatment. Court sets bond. Defendant may appear for hearings via zoom if in treatment if documents are provided.
Absolute sobriety. Submit to random testing.

1:09 PM Defendant Jacob R Miller appeared by video, in custody. Court calls case-. State appears by Aaron Marcoux. Alysja Otten appears for the Public Defenders office.
Court questions defendant.

State makes bond argument-requesting cash bond. Attorney Otten makes argument. Court sets bond.
